data.title: Is it Still Good to Ya? Fifty Years of Rock Criticism 1967–2002. By Robert Christgau. Durham, NC: Duke University Press, 2018. 444 pp. ISBN 978-1-4780-0022-8 - Book Reports: a Music Critic on his Firs
data.meta_description: Is it Still Good to Ya? Fifty Years of Rock Criticism 1967–2002. By Robert Christgau. Durham, NC: Duke University Press, 2018. 444 pp. ISBN 978-1-4780-0022-8 - Book Reports: a Music Critic on his First Love, which was Reading. By Robert Christgau. Durham, NC: Duke University Press, 2019. 398 pp. ISBN 978-1-4780-0030-3‡ - Volume 39 Issue 2
data.text:
Abstract

An abstract is not available for this content so a preview has been provided. Please use the Get access link above for information on how to access this content.

Type

Reviews

Copyright

Copyright © The Author(s), 2020. Published by Cambridge University Press

Access options

Get access to the full version of this content by using one of the access options below. (Log in options will check for institutional or personal access. Content may require purchase if you do not have access.)

References

Christgau, R. 1973/2000. Any Old Way you Choose it: Rock and Other Pop Music, 1967–1973 (New York, Cooper Street Press)Google Scholar

Christgau, R. 1982. Christgau's Record Guide: Rock Albums of the Seventies (London, Vermilion)Google Scholar

Christgau, R. 1990. Christgau's Record Guide: the 80s (New York, Pantheon Books)Google Scholar

Christgau, R. 1998. Grown up all Wrong: 75 Great Rock and Pop Artists from Vaudeville to Techno (Cambridge, MA, Harvard University Press)Google Scholar

Christgau, R. 2000. Christgau's Consumer Guide: Albums of the 90s (New York, St Martin's Griffin)Google Scholar

Christgau., R. 2003. ‘A history of rock criticism’, in Szanto, A., Levy, D. S. and Tyndall, A. (eds), Reporting the Arts II: New Coverage of Arts and Culture in America (New York, National Arts Journalism Program), pp. 140–3Google Scholar

Christgau, R. 2012. ‘Darkest America’, Barnes and Noble Book Review, 24 August 24 (not paginated). https://www.robertchristgau.com/xg/bn/2012-08.php (accessed )Google Scholar

Christgau, R. 2015. Going into the City: Portrait of the Critic as a Young Man (New York, Dey Street/Harper Collins)Google Scholar

Lindberg, U., Guđmundsson, G., Michelsen, M., and Weisethaunet, H. 2005. Rock Criticism from the Beginning: Amusers, Bruisers and Cool-Headed Cruisers (New York, Peter Lang)Google Scholar

Panken, T. 2019. ‘Still good to him: Robert Christgau on a life of writing about listening’, Barnes and Noble Review, 20 December (not paginated). https://www.barnesandnoble.com/review/still-good-to-him-robert-christgau-on-a-life-of-writing-about-listening (accessed )Google Scholar

A correction has been issued for this article:

Is it Still Good to Ya? Fifty Years of Rock Criticism 1967–2002. By Robert Christgau. Durham, NC: Duke University Press, 2018. 444 pp. ISBN 978-1-4780-0022-8. Book Reports: a Music Critic on his First Love, which was Reading. By Robert Christgau. Durham, NC: Duke University Press, 2019. 398 pp. ISBN 978-1-4780-0030-3 – ERRATUM
